title: Angelina Jolie's kids join her on 'Maleficent: Mistress of Evil' red carpet
text:
The "Mistress of Evil" was back on the big screen Monday night and Angelina Jolie's family came out to support mom in her new film.

Five of her six children came out for the debut of the "Maleficent" sequel and Jolie was stunning as per usual, with some inspiration, of course, from her famed Disney character.

The photos show the Oscar winner in all black, much like her misunderstood, empowering character.

Well, well.. Angelina Jolie is back as #Maleficent: Mistress of Evil! 😈 pic.twitter.com/gptD0QH8Nz — Maleficent: Mistress of Evil (@Maleficent) October 1, 2019

Fans lost their mind as Jolie even went into the crowd to embrace them.

Walking into the #Maleficent: Mistress of Evil World Premiere like: pic.twitter.com/XFMvtEbbs1 — Maleficent: Mistress of Evil (@Maleficent) October 1, 2019

Jolie stopped to console one fan, seemingly moved to tears.

But the family was all smiles as Zahara, Pax, Knox, Vivienne and Shiloh all supported mom on her big day. Only Maddox was absent -- he's overseas at college.

Kevin Winter/Getty Images

Jolie was also accompanied by her impressive "Mistress of Evil" cast, including fellow film icon, Michelle Pfeiffer, who plays Queen Ingrith in the movie.

Elle Fanning also stunned on the carpet. She returns in the movie as the young heroine Princess Aurora.

"Maleficent: Mistress of Evil" his theaters nationwide Oct. 18.

ABC News is part of parent company Disney.
